intro: Melochia corchorifolia, commonly known as the velvetleaf or blue morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces clusters of small, pale blue or white flowers that bloom in the early morning. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Melochia corchorifolia is often found in disturbed areas and can be invasive in some regions.
